section.title: How to organize wizards using the <rich:modalPanel> component?
section.para: It's necessary to put <a4j:include> inside the <rich:modalPanel> and perform navigation inside it, as it's shown in the example below:
section.programlisting: ... Show Modal Panel ... faces-config.xml: ... /pages/included1.xhtml included2 /pages/included2.xhtml ... included1.xhtml: ... ... included2.xhtml ... ...

For more information follow the link.

section.title: Is it possible to customize the look of dataScroller (the forward/back buttons) and replace them with an images?
section.para: The answer is yes.
Component provides two controllers groups for switching:

itemizedlist.listitem: Page numbers for switching onto a particular page

section.para: The controls of fast switching are created adding the facets component with the corresponding name:
section.programlisting: ... <rich:datascroller for="table" maxPages="10"> <f:facet name="first"> <h:outputText value="First"/> </f:facet> <f:facet name="last"> <h:outputText value="Last"/> </f:facet> </rich:datascroller> ...
section.para: There are also facets used to create the disabled states: "first_disabled", "last_disabled", "next_disabled", "previous_disabled", "fastforward_disabled", "fastrewind_disabled".

section.title: Can I use dropDownMenu as context menu?
section.para: The <rich:dropDownMenu> is designed keeping in mind that it should not be used for a contextMenu purpose. We have a <rich:contextMenu> component in the TODO list. However, it is not schedule for the nearest versions.

section.para: It's not possible to place tabs upright in the tabPanel. For this purporse use togglePanel. Toggle controls can be placed anywhere in the layout.

section.title: How to get a commandButton working within the modalPanel?
section.para: Simple code is placed below:
section.programlisting: ... <rich:modalPanel> <f:facet name="header"> <h:outputText value="Test" /> </f:facet> <f:facet name="controls"> <h:commandLink value="Close" style="cursor:pointer" onclick="Richfaces.hideModalPanel('mp')" /> </f:facet> <h:form> <t:commandButton value="Test" action="#{TESTCONTROLLER.test}" /> </h:form> </rich:modalPanel> ...

para.note:
Note:Two rules are important for modalPanel:
modalPanel must have its own form if it has form elements (input or/and command components) inside (as it was shown in the example above) modalPanel must not be included into the form (on any level up) if it has the form inside.

section.title: How to define the currently selected tab?
section.para: Simple code is placed below:
section.programlisting: ... <rich:tabPanel selectedTab="t2"> <rich:tab label="tab 1" name="t1"> <h:outputText value="tab 1" /> </rich:tab> <rich:tab label="tab 1" name="t2"> <h:outputText value="tab 2" /> </rich:tab> <rich:tab label="tab 1" name="t3"> <h:outputText value="tab 3" /> </rich:tab> </rich:tabPanel> ...
